title: First Lady Melania Trump Turns Heads During Press Conference

organizations.name: national museum of african american history

text:
First Lady Melania Trump Turns Heads During Press Conference "... a fashion icon." Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
President Donald Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu Wednesday to discuss the future ofÂ the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. 
Although U.S. foreign policy has called for the creation of a two-state solution in the region, at least under the past several presidents, Trump caused a stirÂ today when he announced his openness to a one-state solution as well. 
Despite the major implications of Trump’s meeting with Netanyahu, he was not the only one turning heads , as first lady Melania Trump debuted yet another stunning outfit at today’s press conference. Advertisement - story continues below 
The first lady wore a white cashmere Karl Lagerfeld pencil skirt and matching jacket for the diplomatic meeting. 
This was Melania Trump’s first public appearance at the White House since the inauguration. Melania Trumpâs Cream Outfit To Welcome Israeli PM Netanyahu Is Her Chicest Yet https://t.co/6OfXbIhEB6 
— Us Weekly (@usweekly) February 16, 2017 I love our first Lady Melania Trump. <3 she is so beautiful and classy.. Just absolutely gorgeous <3 So Proud of… https://t.co/iiAWKDQXwk 
— Sharon Blankenship (@SharonBlankens8) February 16, 2017 
The prime minister’s wife, Sara Netanyahu, was also in attendance andÂ later visited the National Museum of African American History and Culture,Â accompanied by the first lady. Advertisement - story continues below Federal Judge Rejects Tribes’ Move To Halt Construction Of Dakota Access Pipeline 
During the press conference between the president and the Israeli prime minister, said he was in favor of whatever solution the Israelis and Palestinians can agree upon. 
“I’m looking at two states and one state, and I like the one both parties like,” said Trump, who likes to keep people guessing. “I can live with either one.” 
Trump further noted he would like to see Israel curb its production of additional settlements, putting NetanyahuÂ somewhat on the defensive. 
“I’d like to see you pull back on settlements for a little bit,” Trump said to the IsraeliÂ prime minister. What do you think? Comment below and share. Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
